verses.roman:
śrī-gurur uvāca
samyak sampādito vatsa
bhavadbhyāṁ guru-niṣkrayaḥ
ko nu yuṣmad-vidha-guroḥ
kāmānām avaśiṣyate

synonyms: śrī-guruḥ uvāca—Their spiritual master, Sāndīpani Muni, said; samyak—completely; sampāditaḥ—fulfilled; vatsa—my dear boy; bhavadbhyām—by You two; guru-niṣkrayaḥ—the remuneration of one's guru; kaḥ—which; nu—indeed; yuṣmat-vidha—of persons like You; guroḥ—for the spiritual master; kāmānām—of his desires; avaśiṣyate—remains.
translation: The spiritual master said: My dear boys, You two have completely fulfilled the disciple's obligation to reward his spiritual master. Indeed, with disciples like You, what further desires could a guru have?
